I hereby give my consent and written settlement deed of the vacant land of the house and immovable property, which is as follows - You are my wife and I have given you the following property: Out of my affection and affection for you, and because of your dependence on me, I feel that I should give you some immovable property during my lifetime, free of charge, and in return for my love for you, I hereby give you the following immovable property, which is my ancestral property, and which I have all the rights to and is in my possession, as per the following schedule, and is valued at Rs. 6,09,000/-, which is six lakh nine thousand rupees, and is payable to you free of charge, without any consideration whatsoever, by virtue of this settlement deed. As far as such disputes arise, I have not been subject to any of my own agreements, contracts of sale or purchase. I am able to settle the matter with the expenses of the said schedule. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 50 of 2026, dated 09/Jan/2026, executed by V. Selvakumar in favour of his wife, S Bhuvaneswari, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 202.77 Sq. Yds., ward number 14, comprised in survey number 1009/3, situated in Nagalapuram Village, Nagalapuram Mandal, within the District of Tirupati registered at sub-registrar office Pichatur is bounded as follows: North by: House of S.Ramalakshmi South by: House of G. Shanmugam East by: House of Easwaran West by: C.C. Road

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 1009/3, situated in Nagalapuram measuring about 202.77 Sq. Yds., was originally owned by V. Selvakumar. [Ref: Deed] 2. The aforementioned V. Selvakumar executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 9/Jan/2026 registered as document No. 50 of 2026 before the SRO Pichatur in favour of his wife, S. Bhuvaneswari towards the property measuring 202.77 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey no.1009/3, at Nagalapuram Village, Nagalapuram Mandal, within the District of Tirupati. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title 1. The Certificate issued by the Nagalapuram Grama Panchayath dated 30/Jan/2026 discloses that the property bearing house no. 14-51, admeasuring 202.77 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey no 1009/3, situated at Nagalapuram Grama Panchayath dated 30/Jan/2026 discloses that the property bearing house no. 14-51, admeasuring 202.77 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey no 1009/3, situated at Nagalapuram is vested in the name of Yagamma as per their record from 1992 to 2015, thereafter the property got transferred to V. Selvakumar from 2015 to 2026, and subsequently the property got transferred to S. Bhuvaneswari 09/Jan/2026 to till the date. 2. Encumbrance Certificate vide Statement No. 139864385 dated 29/Jan/2026, extracted for the period commencing from 01-Jan-1983 to 29-Jan-2026 with respect to the Schedule Property does not reflect any adverse entries.
The mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner, S. Bhuvaneswari.

contentList: Document Name * Document Description * Document Date * Document Type

sections.content: We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the S Bhuvaneswari, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property measuring 202.77 Sq. Yds, comprised in survey number 1009/3, situated in Nagalapuram, within the District of Tirupati registered at sub-registrar office Pichatur

Note: The EC has been verified and downloaded using the property address parameter, as the option to retrieve EC records using the document number is currently unavailable in the Online EC portal. Further, It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
